intro: Pseudocaryophyllus platyphyllus, commonly known as the flat-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, often pink or white flowers. The plant has succulent leaves that are typically broad and flat, adapted to store water in dry environments. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
